Posts.Content: kaza wrote: I have been on Aremadix for 2.5 years, my skin was always very oily prior to dx, i have found my skin is now drier . Just had to mention i have been using a face cream called Dr Nick Lowe, this range is fab!!!! my skin looks radiant and feels much better. Just had to share it with you, does anyone else use this range of skin care. best wishes to allx   Dx 7/17/2009, IDC, 2cm, Stage IA, Grade 1, PR+, HER2- Surgery 10/16/2009 Mastectomy: Left; Reconstruction (left): Latissimus dorsi flap Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Skin care while on hormonals kaza kaza

Posts.Content: Jan 1, 2013 03:01PM kaza wrote: Since my dx......i do look after myself, i do not deny myself things i enjoy...everything in moderation, us gals have been through so much surely we can have a little of what we fancy,xx
Posts.Title: What changes have you made after dx? Speedy4 msphil

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2013 05:48PM kaza wrote: Hi bedo, not a dumb question at all, i had the same dx as you, i feel we had early stage breast cancer with a good prognosis, BUT we did have cancer, it was removed and now were are on medication to reduce the risk of the cancer returning. I am positive most of the time and try to get on with living and enjoying life, but once in a while this little monster creeps in, i have to say it it scares me, i just want to be as i was before, i was at work the other night, came across some paperwork i had written about a year before dx, i had to re ~ read it, this was the old me, hard to remember what the old me was like, i certainly had more confidence in every way . Not sure about this consider ourselves cured.....we could very well be cured, but we will never know no one rearly knows, i hope to be a little old lady, putting in my rollers at night as i see lots of them at work, oooh how i would love that, we can only hope, remain vigilant to bodily changes and be here for each other, kaza xx

Posts.Content: Sep 5, 2012 02:32PM kaza wrote: Hi chabba i guess we do feel well and look well. But inside we are still having bad days. Bad day for me today. My neighbour is terminal with breast cancer, i rearly feel for her . having ambulances coming and going daily is such a reminder to me how serious this disease is. It is wonderfull to have all our friends here to share and care for each other. I keep thinking it is nearly 3years for me since dx i am positive most of the time i guess some things just remind us of what we have actually been throughxxxx

Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2012 10:42AM kaza wrote: Joan811  On reading your post i felt i had to say how i feel. We stage one ladies have been through an emotional rollercoaster!!!  just because we are stage one does not make us fortunate in anyway, we are not blessed or lucky, we have had cancer we do not know what the future holds regarding our health. It makes me so angry when our stage is said to be lucky how can we possibly be lucky. many of us suffer greatly emotionally coming to terms with our dx .  Sorry to be blunt it just makes me so angry. hugs to all xxxxxxx
